title: Remember when we had a mastery tree that allowed us to make decisions?

embed.description: Imgur: The most awesome images on the Internet.

body:
The tree we had before keystones existed not only provided way more options and enhancements to your champion, but in my opinion came off as a HELL of a lot more creative which in turn allowed you to be more creative. I used to have so much fun mixing and matching runes and masteries for my favorite champions and seeing what really fit my playstyle, I remember picking 17/0/13 on my top lane Shen back in the day and thinking it was the coolest thing ever getting healed extra from my Q (RIP Vorpal Blade).

 It's way more cookie cutter than it ever has been and regardless of this season's additions, it has just as many non-decisions as the new tree always has (Looking at you, Courage. And Perserverance. And Veteran's Scars. Well, basically all of Resolve). I know this game will never be immune to change and I'll always keep up with it's current state, but for me it was during the keystone release that my personal enjoyment dropped off to a pretty extreme degree.

replies.body: Yeah, I liked the old system much better too

I think the combinations you could make were way more interesting and made the trial and error of mixing things much more fun. Also I always found it strange that we have less options than before and some bonuses were just plainly removed.
This is the problem with hiring WoW's old Devs.

The funny thing is the first time I saw it I thought "Who the hell gave us the skill tree from WoW in 2003"

LOL

The problem was the same as the old WoW trees that gave you a point every time you leveled past 10: You have a lot of potential options but unless you're okay with gimping yourself compared to what's optimal then you'll realistically be using the same talents as everyone else while a bunch of the options you could have had go unpicked for the majority of players. 

For most people I knew, they looked up the optimal masteries and then never changed them unless what was considered optimal for the champion they were playing changed. The same thing happened in WoW circa 2004 all the way up until Cataclysm when the talent system was changed to the system they currently use. 

The old mastery trees in League were a bunch of passive bonuses that gave small boosts to everyone, but if everyone is using the same masteries then why even have them since everyone is just getting the same small boosts to their base stats effectively. Might as well remove them and quit with any of the pretense since, when considering optimization, there is no real choice: there's only a mathematically superior option and a mathematically inferior option, and if you're optimizing then you won't take the inferior option.

You can wear your nostalgia glasses, but remember that there were definitely problems with the past systems, just like there are with this one.
Yeah, you're right in that some of the choices were more specialized than others, but currently there aren't really choices at all.

I'd rather see masteries just get removed and have riot add more run combinations, improve rune cost, and balance rune efficiency better.

If anyone played Infinite Crisis they had a pretty interesting setup for "runes" (just about every stat combination you could think of) and opened up some interesting possibilities.

Granted some runes will be niche (for both certain situations, champions, maps, etc), but having choices and versatility wouldn't hurt (assuming they balanced efficiency vs cost).

That would definitely be interesting to see, but you might even be able to say the Runes are in a bigger state of disrepair than the Masteries are. You have at most 3 to 4 runes in every category that are good and the rest are very literally noob traps.

Good example of that is the %health runes. You have to have a little under 5k health for them to be better than the scaling health runes. So basically, they're completely pointless.
Three choices are still better than none.
Definitely true, however I do wish they'd tweak rune efficiency every once in a while as well, since there are some that just undebatably fall completely short.

I'm sure they could do that, if there were no other factors.

Sadly, the masteries are such a big issue, I keep on forgetting half the runes are nigh useless.
I kinda feel like a fool for having 20 runepages on this account. At any given time you're gonna need maybe 4 at most. Hell, my AD page works just as fine on Thresh as it does for Draven. XD

That much is a sad fact, that I too have full runepages.

Sad fact that something like 90% of the runes are honestly not worth it (I know, I have some pretty stupid pages).

I have done a lot of experimenting, but unfortunately with how certain runes are (efficiency per cost per slot) and the amount of power given, trying to come up with good combinations for niche champions/roles/situations becomes unfeasible and not worth the ip or stats.

Btw, people. That little 21 offense point? It gave 3% additional damage.

You can get far more than that out of 12 or fewer points in either cunning or ferocity now. 

Meanwhile resolve/defense tree was gutted.

God, I miss having a strong defensive tree.

0/30/0 and 9/21/0 masteries were just as satisfying as 30/0/0 and 21/9/0.

I miss actual options. 

Masteries now are just "Which Keystone do you want?", and a bunch of arbitrary, albeit strong, filler...besides Resolve.
God is the resolve tree just sad. They need to rework that entire tree, ESPECIALLY the keystones. or you know, just get rid of the keystones altogether and make the game better for it. Either or.

I think satisfying might be the perfect word. I remember playing Kayle back then with 30/0/0 thinking "Man, this tree is gonna screw people up!" Now it just feels like "Hey look, I'm using the one pile of stats that makes Ezreal effective."

The worst part is they said they wanted to sheer away from keystones acting as "Flat steroids" like that. Ok, explain Bond of Stone then.

{{sticker:slayer-jinx-unamused}}

Useless.

There's the explanation.
It's not useless, it just isn't as  flashy as the others.

There is no scenario where 4% damage reduction and free damage tanking for your allies would ever be more useful than a potential 25% max health shield. Especially since as a tank you should be tanking damage without the keystone.
I've read a post where someone did the math, now it is like 21-24% damage increase. Yes, I did not expect this huge number either.

There's a reason champions with high base numbers make such good supports now. 

Even Sion/Poppy.

I'm actually impressed they managed to make this Poppy more broken than the original one. That's quite an impressive programming feat, considering the other one could go invulnerable for 8 seconds. Well done again Rito

{{sticker:slayer-jinx-catface}}
Now she's invulnerable for infinite seconds.

I would prefer a way to directly increase my champions starting stats, at the EXPENSE of other stats. So a {{champion:157}} could build AD but LOSE MR and Armor, making him have to play more carefully.
That would be interesting to see as well, more of like a tweaking system. Give up 1.5 MR for 1 AD, something along those lines. To be honest, almost anything would be better than what's in place now.

Ahh, the times when you could go 30/0/0, 0/30/0 or 0/0/30...you'd be a fool to do it, but you still had the choice.

http://ps4daily.com/wp-content/uploads/2013/06/freedom-braveheart.jpg

It's kinda funny though - all these threads about how the current state of League of Legends is not as good as it used to be compared to 2-3 seasons back...what if they made "Vanilla LoL" as a Rotating Game Mode, giving us, say, patch 3.14 for few weekends over a year?

Or even just testing what the reception would be of such a thing on the Boards or - Teemo forbid - Reddit.
If it gets an overall good reception, that should be a clear indication that _someone_ needs to go back to the drawing board... And if not, well, make it an RGQ anyway fur teh lulz.
I would love to go back to Season 2 Worlds patch or pre-juggernaut patch for example. Those were some of the best days in league in my opinion.
3.14...is this before the feral flare? For me I had the most fun during the feral flare meta.

the old mastery tree didnt need the final mastery, i frequently remember people using incomplete trees and completely stomping.

Tbh I think power at the end of the tree has always been the biggest factor holding it back. It was a great mix and match system to fine tune your champion specifically to you back then, always thought that was really cool. Now there's at most 2 non-keystone masteries you could even consider swapping when picking a champion
30/0/0 was the best on akali, Kayle and had.
0/30/0 was the best on Mundo.
0/30/0 was the best on most champs that wanted to get even slightly tanky.
